solution_line_template: There are {total_students} students x {fraction_six_dollars} = <<{total_students}*{fraction_six_dollars}={students_six_dollars}>>{students_six_dollars} students who have a $6 daily allowance.

While there are {total_students} students - {students_six_dollars} students = <<{total_students}-{students_six_dollars}={students_four_dollars}>>{students_four_dollars} students who have a $4 daily allowance.

The sum of the allowances of the {students_six_dollars} students who received $6 daily is {students_six_dollars} students x ${allowance_six}/day = $<<{students_six_dollars}*{allowance_six}={total_six_dollar_allowance}>>{total_six_dollar_allowance}.

The sum of the allowances of the {students_four_dollars} students who received $4 daily is {students_four_dollars} students x ${allowance_four}/day = $<<{students_four_dollars}*{allowance_four}={total_four_dollar_allowance}>>{total_four_dollar_allowance}.

The total daily amount of money of those {total_students} students is ${total_six_dollar_allowance} + ${total_four_dollar_allowance} = $<<{total_six_dollar_allowance}+{total_four_dollar_allowance}={total_allowance}>>{total_allowance}.
